comments.body:
I'm guessing this will just block the caller as opposed to returning a RetryRequest error? (and I guess that's ok from the client perspective). Can you please add a comment. 

I guess it would be nice if you returned the error so the caller can, for example, submit the request to another region (these are per region right?). Just a thought.

Will add a comment.

This is intended as a last resort; it will likely end up with the k8s cluster becoming slow/unresponsive.  But we have to protect the AWS account; once we start hitting rate limits both k8s and anything else running on the account cease to be operation.

This has to happen in conjunction with retry policies in controllers, for example.  But we know we won't find all the error cases, and so this is our last line of defense.
